discussion.content:
Block
Immutable blob storage

To deploy a solution that provides point-in-time restore for blobs in storage accounts with blob versioning and blob soft delete enabled, you should create a Block Blob. 
For the accounts, you should enable Immutable Blob Storage. This ensures that data cannot be modified or deleted after it has been written, providing a safeguard for your data.

Given answer is correct
Check below all in there - look at Data Protection => Recovery and Tracking
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/storage-blob-change-feed?tabs=azure-portal

The answer is correct
1. Only block blobs in a standard general-purpose v2 storage account can be restored as part of a point-in-time restore operation. Append blobs, page blobs, and premium block blobs aren't restored
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/point-in-time-restore-overview
2. Prequesits to enable restoring 
Soft delete
Change feed
Blob versioning

Point-in-time restore requires that the following Azure Storage features be enabled before you can enable point-in-time restore:

Soft delete
Change feed
Blob versioning
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/point-in-time-restore-overview

Only block blobs in a standard general-purpose v2 storage account can be restored as part of a point-in-time restore operation. Append blobs, page blobs, and premium block blobs aren't restored.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/point-in-time-restore-overview#limitations-and-known-issues
Change feed is a prerequisite feature for Object Replication and Point-in-time restore for block blobs.
